messages.title: Why I'm standing to represent you
messages.content: I'm standing because Orkney and Shetland needs a strong local voice. The Tories and the SNP are holding working families back. Only Labour will build a Britain for the many, not the few, and oppose a second independence referendum.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Lifting the national minimum wage to £10 an hour
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will take the initiative and make sure that all employees can expect a fair day's pay for a fair day's work.
Will oppose a hard Brexit and work tirelessly to ensure that our fishing and crofting communities don't lose out.
Will support our doctors and nurses to secure the future of our life-saving service for women and everyone else.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Being a strong voice for women
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will be at the forefront of the national movement to end violence against women and girls.
Will do all I can to ensure the environment is protected and tackle the causes and effects of climate change.

issues.brexitEurope: Will oppose a hard Brexit and work tirelessly to ensure that our fishing and crofting communities don't lose out.
issues.education: I will fight to secure essential funding for our schools, hospitals and care services.
issues.environment: Will do all I can to ensure the environment is protected and tackle the causes and effects of climate change.
issues.health: I will fight to secure essential funding for our schools, hospitals and care services.

housing.content: We can take real pride in our islands with their unique natural and cultural heritage, but securing a sustainable future is a challenge. I will fight for the affordable reliable transport services and digital connectivity that we need to thrive.

images.caption: FOR THE MANY NOT THE FEW
Elect Robina Rendall Barton. Labour candidate for Orkney and Shetland.
